trans-unit.source: Allows coordination of initialization for a component and its dependent properties.

You should implement this interface when your component has initialization dependencies on other components that also implement the <xref:System.ComponentModel.ISupportInitializeNotification> interface.
You can check to see if the dependent components have completed initialization by checking the <xref:System.ComponentModel.ISupportInitializeNotification.IsInitialized%2A> property.
<xref:System.ComponentModel.ISupportInitializeNotification> is implemented by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.BindingSource> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl> types.
Occurs when initialization of the component is completed.

This event typically occurs during the call to the <xref:System.ComponentModel.ISupportInitialize.EndInit%2A> method for the component, but it may occur later if the component has dependent controls that implement the <xref:System.ComponentModel.ISupportInitializeNotification> interface and the dependent controls have not completed initialization.
For more information about handling events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).
Gets a value indicating whether the component is initialized.

The <xref:System.ComponentModel.ISupportInitializeNotification.IsInitialized%2A> property is automatically set to `false` when the <xref:System.ComponentModel.ISupportInitialize.BeginInit%2A> method is called, and `true` when the <xref:System.ComponentModel.ISupportInitialize.EndInit%2A> method is called.
`true` to indicate the component has completed initialization; otherwise, `false`.
